title: Sporting cup runneth over
text:
A LL the celebrations may be over for another year but now is a good time to be thinking about joining the party for the 2016 AFL Grand Final in Melbourne. 
No matter which team you follow, you can't beat Melbourne's week-long festivities centred around all things football, Australian Rules-style. 
Every year, Grand Final Week in Melbourne delivers all the usual pageantry, glamour and fanaticism we've come to know and love. 
Each year, Friday boasts the free parade through CBD streets - this year in glorious spring weather. 
Footy fans can cheer on their favourite players who will battle it out in the grand final in a cavalcade of gleaming cars, marching bands and street entertainers that ends in Yarra Park, surrounding the MCG, in the heart of the Melbourne Sports and Entertainment Precinct. 
And the big men fly, of course, on grand final day and ticket packages and tours are available through AFL clubs if you are an eligible member, and authorised sellers such as http://www.premiumseats.com.au. 
Register your interest with these clubs, tour companies and websites such as http://www.afleventoffice.com.au/ 
grand_final_packages.asp and keep updated through regular emails. 
Public tickets also are available to other major end-of-season events such as the Brownlow Medal Dinner and traditional North Melbourne Grand Final Breakfast. 
Federation Square may be the next best option for those unlucky to secure MCG seating for the big one, with coverage of the match on a towering screen and live entertainment in the popular city meeting place. 
Crown Sports Bar on the casino floor is another favoured venue with its massive TV screen and multiple other flat screens handy, as well as TAB facilities in the bar. 
It started to fill with eager Hawthorn and West Coast fans decked out in their jerseys and team colours from either side of 
the Nullabor right from breakfast time for this year's grand final. 
But really, just about any major pub or bar in the southern capital's city centre and suburbs score points for hospitality with everyday punters treated to all the live action on TV screens, and the possibility of free nibblies, discount drinks, competitions and raffles. Organise your own footy trip away with partners, family and friends and get up close and personal with all the high-flying action. 
The fun and entertainment don't end at the final siren, though. 
The premiership party is a post-match celebration from 6pm featuring the AFL Grand Final Day artists and the presentation of the AFL premiers to the crowd. 
For those who can't get enough footy, relive all your own glory days or simply have a kick-a-round on the hallowed turf with your mates and little tackers when the MCG opens its doors to the public on the Sunday - the day after the big game. afl
